item.title: Setting up pre-commit hook for iOS
item.description:
Many of us already write unit tests and run continuous integration servers, we can also leverage great tools like Danger to easily add some checks to the pull requests.

If we’d like to prevent some common mistakes from appearing in the repo in the first place, we can use pre-commit hook.

item.title: iOS tips
item.description: Easy to apply tips that can improve your development workflow.

item.title: iOS Developer Tools
item.description:
I probably spend too much money on apps, but I like to support other Developer’s good ideas.

I recently gave talk about tools I use and why.

item.title: Crafter - setup your cocoa projects with ease
item.description:
How do you setup your Cocoa projects? Do you always set same warnings, clone configurations and do bunch of other stuff?

I made a tool that might help.

item.title: Statusboard and Jenkins
item.description: You probably saw StatusBoard by Panic. I’ve immediately thought it needs simple Jenkins widget.

item.title: Overlaying application version on top of your icon
item.description:
I’ve just returned from NSConference #5, there were many good talks there, but my favourite one was the one about Flipboard development tools/setup by Evan Doll.

Especially how they add version information on top of the icons. Unfortunately they didn’t share it with us.

So I wrote my own.
